subject: What's TFP? (RE: Unit test for infinite loop)
msgSnippet: TFP = Test First Programming . Look it up on http://www.xprogramming.com and http://www.extremeprogramming.org for details. Pardon me for using the acronym;
messageBody:
TFP = "Test First Programming". Look it up on http://www.xprogramming.com
and http://www.extremeprogramming.org for details. Pardon me for using the
acronym; I'm so used to it by now that I don't usually give it a second
thought.

JBR.

-----Begin original message-----
What does TFP stand for?

Donald Holliday


-----Original Message-----
From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains762@...]
Sent: Sunday, October 21, 2001 6:09 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Unit test for infinite loop


> How does one write a unit test that exposes an infinte loop? Well,
writing
> one that exposes it isn't hard. How do you expose it with out the test
> hanging?

Suggestion 1: Don't expose the infinite loop. Expose the "whatever goes
wrong because of the infinite loop". That's much easier and equally
effective at giving you confidence you'll fix the bug. Then fix the infinite
loop. It's extremely unlikely you or someone else will come along and put it
back in there.

Suggestion 2: Do TFP. You can't have an infinite loop for long with TFP. :)

JBR.
